TopicTitle: I think "The Space Lounge" is a better name.

Articles.Content: Better than "The Junkyard".
Indeed, now we are in space than a junkyard, LEVEL UP!
... and check out the new thread prefixes! We're still working on small features at the moment but I think it's really looking good so far
Change: It doesn't have to be big.
....I liked junkyard...

....I liked junkyard...

No you didn't, you only think you did.

No, junkyard was good - it gave me a feeling of..freedom. You know, like the freedom in you living room, to wear only shorts....or nothing at all. Back then I could write whatever I liked, whenever I liked...

Now, we are in a "Lounge", I have to wear a tuxedo, eat with knife and fork, drink Gin&Tonic and talk in a grandiloquent way.

Back then I could write whatever I liked, whenever I liked...

False. Rules still applied when it was the junkyard.
You see? Now we are in a lounge and people start correcting me....
A lounge, not with poems and rubbish, but SCIENCE (that belongs to the Labs) STUFF! and some poetry... and rubbish... Sounds quite classy, approved.
Well, now that we are all fancy and classy, I vote, that you have to listen to this whenever you are browsing the junkyard lounge:

Well, now that we are all fancy and classy, I vote, that you have to listen to this whenever you are browsing the junkyard lounge:

Well, actually latin is so....old.....french would be much fancier. I would vote for german, but you lot would only think that I'm screaming orders....
Nein, ich denke, wir sollten tanzen!

Jawohl! Ein Tanz!

Ps: I think we should switch back to english soon before the mods get mad.

A very good idea, as non english posts are against the rules outside of the dedicated non-english sections.

I rather liked having it as the Junkyard, although this is acceptable too.
Allright, so we'll stick to english - although I think thats not very classy
I think everyone is suffering from JWD (Junkyard Withdrawl Disorder). But I have a solution to the non-English problem that's still fancy: let's all speak Briti-- *bricked*

Allright, so we'll stick to english - although I think thats not very classy

Just read everything with the voice a upper class brit or Morgan Freeman to make it seem classy.
Well, sadly my british accent is not very good - got most of my english from watching american movies. But I could try a Bane imitation....
what about old english...then again what about proper english ,or something.
